page_analysis.text_content:
Projections

Architectural relief
features such as bay
windows are pleasant
additions to a house
design and are
encouraged. If they
meet certain design
criteria they do not
count toward gross
floor area.

Bay windows

Bay windows that meet the design criteria below are considered to be decorative
architectural features and do NOT count toward gross floor area.

Design criteria for bay windows that do not count:

• Bottom of feature must be at least 18" above the floor joists
• Exterior supports must be features like corbels and/or brackets
  rather than solid walls
• At least 50% of the surface is glass

Fig 13 Bay windows

2' max. from bay window
surface to facade surface
(Typical all)

Note: Bay windows that ex-
tend higher than the struc-
ture's roof are considered
to be dormers and count to-
ward gross floor area.

18

Code sections
18.04.030(a)(65)
18.12.040(b)Table 3

A
Does NOT count

B
Counts because floor
joists continue into the
bay window

C & D
Count because of exterior skirt wall
(angled or straight)

E
Counts because the
surface is not at least
50% glass

visual_elements.description: A series of five cross-sectional diagrams (labeled A through E) illustrating different bay window configurations and whether they count towards gross floor area. Each diagram shows a portion of a building wall with a bay window structure. Diagram A shows a bay window that does not count, with its bottom at least 18 inches above the floor joists and supported by corbels. Diagram B shows a bay window that counts because the floor joists extend into it. Diagrams C & D show bay windows that count due to an exterior skirt wall (one angled, one straight). Diagram E shows a bay window that counts because less than 50% of its surface is glass. A vertical dimension line indicates '18" min. from top of floor to bottom of baywindow structure' for diagram A. A horizontal dimension line indicates '2' max. from bay window surface to facade surface (Typical all)' for the projection of the bay window from the main wall.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page, spanning horizontally across the content area.

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum height of bay window bottom above floor joists
Minimum glass surface percentage for non-counting bay windows
Maximum projection of bay window from facade

subheadings: Design criteria for bay windows that do not count:
sections: Architectural relief features such as bay windows are pleasant additions to a house design and are encouraged. If they meet certain design criteria they do not count toward gross floor area.
Bay windows that meet the design criteria below are considered to be decorative architectural features and do NOT count toward gross floor area.
Note: Bay windows that extend higher than the structure's roof are considered to be dormers and count toward gross floor area.

additional_notes: The page number '18' is located at the bottom left.
The text 'feature' is misspelled as 'teature' in the bullet points under 'Design criteria for bay windows that do not count:'.
The text 'Fig 13 Bay windows' serves as a caption for the diagram.
The labels A, B, C & D, E correspond to the individual bay window diagrams and describe why they either count or do not count towards gross floor area.
